data.title: The go to place for breakfast
data.text: Try the corned beef hash - superb. The ambiance is great Service very efficient and the food excellent. Outdoor gas heating if it is chilly.

data.title: Great Breakfast! Going back for lunch soon.
data.text: Very good breakfast, great coffee, and great service. This small and quiet place has a lot going for it. The whole staff endeavor to make your experience a good one. From classic breakfast dishes to the more eclectic tastes, they have it. Definitely worth a stop for breakfast or lunch.

data.title: Family Breakfast
data.text:
My mother, teenage niece and I had breakfast in this eatery. Order an omelet, it come with red potatoes or fruit and toast. 

Get there early or it can get very tricky to find parking.

data.title: Best omelette!
data.text: We stayed at the Carlsbad Inn, and this restaurant is just across the parking lot. Hands down, I had the best omelette I've ever had. It was very light and fluffy. I had breakfast potatoes which were tasty and not greasy at all. My husband had hash browns and they were just crunchy enough on the outside but soft on the inside. Perfect! Word of caution: don't order the biscuit, it was very dry. And you can expect to spend $40 if you get coffee and juice with breakfast.

data.title: Beautiful setting, great breakfast
data.text: We stayed in Carlsbad for 3 nights at the Inn next door to this restaurant in May '16. We absolutely loved having such an inviting, clean, and delicious place to have breakfast each morning. The service was good and the food was delicious. Great little town to walk around too with shopping and gorgeous beaches.

data.title: Wow
data.text: This place is just so awesome.  We called ahead of time the first time for breakfast to put our name in when they said it was a 10-15 minute wait for breakfast, but when we got there, there was no wait.  The orange juice tastes fresh squeezed, the portions are big and worth it, the blueberry muffins (warmed) are tasty, and the service is really on the ball.  Their menu is extensive with alot of different choices, so you could have eggs, pancakes, crepes, french toast, whatever you are in the mood for.  They do breakfast all day, so you don't have to worry about what time it is to get breakfast.  We came back here for breakfast again and it was just as good as the first time.  We will totally come back here again.

data.title: Hubby's Favorite
data.text: One of our "musts" on our Carlsbad visits. Love the atmosphere, food and service. Great location and close to the beach if you're on your way. Also, right by shopping.

data.title: GREAT blueberry muffins!
data.text: Located right next to the Carlsbad Inn where we were staying.  You have the choice of inside or outside seating.  The food is terrific and the blueberry muffins are to die for!  Typical California "hipster" wait staff but good food at a good price.

data.title: Breakfast is a WOW ! --
data.text: We went here for breakfast.  The menu has a lot of options so anyone should be able to enjoy a good meal.  They also serve lunch.  Food was very good, portions substantial, and the service was excellent.  Dining on the covered patio makes this especially pleasant.

data.title: Great breakfast cafe!
data.text: Great place for breakfast with lots of options. They will totally customize anything for you which is hard to find these days. Fresh squeezed juices and yummy pastry options along with omelets, crepes, French toast and everything else you could want. We went for breakfast on a Saturday morn just g and waited about ten minutes for a table. Indoor and outdoor seating is available. (Outside is good for people watching!) Be fore warned that parking on the weekend is tough. Open for breakfast & lunch near the beautiful Carlsbad coast!

data.title: Great food; dine in or on the patio!
data.text: We were in Carlsbad for a week and had breakfast here three times! Fresh, creative omelets, all cooked just as requested, served hot and in a timely manner too.

data.title: Go to breakfast place
data.text: Just across the parking lot from Carlsbad Inn. All of the staff were super friendly, including the busboys (is that politically correct). Nice cozy comfortable spot. Family friendly. Good food.

data.title: Bad News Cafe
data.text: We were told this was the best breakfast in town.  Well maybe it was when the town was smaller.  We decided to try their lunch.  What a disappointment.  The building need cleaning and remodeling, the restrooms need a guide.  The server was polite and that was the best part.  We followed her advice on the fish tacos and Philly steak sandwich.  Neither were of any quality or taste and for almost thirty dollars we should opted for Taco Bell.

data.title: Large Portions - Big enough to share
data.text: We had the Greek Salad, which was plentiful and filling. Also tried the chowder. This place is known for breakfast but lunch was good too. We ate outside in front patio which could do with a cleaning and refresh - but food was good enough.

data.title: the daily blues???
data.text: with the Elysa Cafe  literally across the street, why anyone would go here is a true mystery.  The microwave at this "restaurant"  works  overtime.  I am not totally sure if they even have a kitchen.  With so many choices of eateries in beautiful Carlsbad, I truly don't understand how this establishment stays in business.  My guess would be  because it is connected to a resort, and it is an easy choice.   Really, just blocks away are family run, locally  owned  breakfast/lunch places to eat.  Please take a nice stroll through the Village, enjoy the sun, and find another place to eat.

data.title: Great Breakfast
data.text: Great breakfast variety.  Reasonable prices for area. we have eaten there several times.  It is on the beach rode and is constantly attended by locals

data.title: Breakfast
data.text: The Daily news reminded me slightly of Yours Truely - it gives the impression of being real family cooking. It's expensive for what you got. Service was okay.

data.title: This is your place to start your day . . .
data.text: Charming patio dining options, good menu, reasonable prices and great food. We enjoyed it so much the first day, we went back for more the next! Excellent staff and service.

data.title: Good place to meet
data.text: Daily News is a solid choice for breakfast and lunch. The food is straightforward: typical breakfasts, sandwiches, soups and salads. The atmosphere is very relaxed and casual. It's not the best place in town, but a good choice for a casual meal that is priced right in a friendly atmosphere.

data.title: Pretty good- better for breakfast than lunch!
data.text: Location is great for guests at Carlsbad Inn.  Our experiences differed, depending on our server.  Our server for breakfast was friendly, helpful and good with children.  Our server for lunch was not exactly "kid-friendly", making our experience less than stellar.  The breakfast menu was more to our liking as well.
